Key Arguments: The Bill is an attack on free speech and should be scrapped.
Free and open public discussion leads to the truth, and the Bill attempts to stifle this.
The Bill will incur enormous compliance costs for digital platforms, potentially leading to service closures or increased user charges.
The definitions of misinformation, disinformation, and harm are vague and open to interpretation.
Existing laws are sufficient to address real harm caused by misinformation.
Digital social media is crucial for providing alternative viewpoints and exposing misinformation from mainstream media and government.
The Bill could lead to totalitarianism by coercing citizens into silence.
Notable Quotes: The proposed Bill is an attack on free speech and should be scrapped.
Free and open public discussion leads to the truth.
The proposed Bill will incur enormous compliance costs for the digital platform services.
We need digital social media to highlight issues and provide alternative viewpoints.
This Bill is an attempt to end public debate by coercing citizens into silence.
